prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation vector: (0.0, 0.29, 0.0) **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Draw a 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should have a rectangular base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. The sketch should have one face (face\\_1), which consists of one loop (loop\\_1). **Step 3: Loop\\_1** Loop\\_1 should consist of the following curves: * line\\_1: Start Point: (0.0, 0.0), End Point: (0.75, 0.0) * line\\_2: Start Point: (0.75, 0.0), End Point: (0.75, 0.12) * line\\_3: Start Point: (0.75, 0.12), End Point: (0.565, 0.12) * line\\_4: Start Point: (0.565, 0.12), End Point: (0.565, 0.25) * line\\_5: Start Point: (0.565, 0.25), End Point: (0.505, 0.25) * arc\\_1: Start Point: (0.505, 0.25), Mid Point: (0.375, 0.12), End Point: (0.245, 0.25) * line\\_6: Start Point: (0.245, 0.25), End Point: (0.185, 0.25) * line\\_7: Start Point: (0.185, 0.25), End Point: (0.185, 0.12) * line\\_8: Start Point: (0.185, 0.12), End Point: (0.0, 0.12) * line\\_9: Start Point: (0.0, 0.12), End Point: (0.0, 0.0) Loop\\_1 is a closed loop, consisting of 9 curves. **Step 4: Scale and extrude the sketch** Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.29 units towards the normal and 0.0 units towards the opposite direction of normals, respectively. **Step 5: Add a description** Add a description of the CAD part, including the following information: * Shape: A three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.29 units * Height: 0.75 units This concludes the instructions for Part 1. Continue to the next part to construct the final shape.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1:** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length of the prism is twice the width, and the height is half the width. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.1125, 0.1125] Next, create the 2D sketch for the prism: * Draw the first line from the point (0.0, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.0) * Draw the second line from the point (0.75, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.0094) * Draw the third line from the point (0.75, 0.0094) to the point (0.0, 0.0094) * Draw the fourth line from the point (0.0, 0.0094) to the point (0.0, 0.0) Now, scale and transform the 2D sketch into 3D: * Set the sketch scale to 0.75 * Apply the Euler angles and Translation Vector from the coordinate system to rotate and translate the 2D sketch into 3D Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: * Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0562 towards the normal * Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0562 in the opposite direction of the normal **Part 2:** Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism inside it, both centered on the same axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.1125, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch for the smaller prism: * Draw the first line from the point (0.0, 0.0) to the point (0.0094, 0.0) * Draw the second line from the point (0.0094, 0.0) to the point (0.0094, 0.1125) * Draw the third line from the point (0.0094, 0.1125) to the point (0.0, 0.1125) * Draw the fourth line from the point (0.0, 0.1125) to the point (0.0, 0.0) Now, create another 2D sketch for the outer boundary of the prism: * Draw a line from the point (0.7406, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.0) * Draw a line from the point (0.75, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.1125) * Draw a line from the point (0.75, 0.1125) to the point (0.7406, 0.1125) * Draw a line from the point (0.7406, 0.1125) to the point (0.7406, 0.0) Now, scale and transform the 2D sketches into 3D: * Set the sketch scale to 0.75 * Apply the Euler angles and Translation Vector from the coordinate system to rotate and translate the 2D sketches into 3D Finally, extrude the 2D sketches to generate the 3D model: * Extrude the inner prism sketch by a depth of 0.0562 towards the normal * Extrude the inner prism sketch by a depth of 0.0562 in the opposite direction of the normal * Extrude the outer prism sketch by a depth of 0.0562 towards the normal * Extrude the outer prism sketch by a depth of 0.0562 in the opposite direction of the normal * Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" boolean operation for the current part with the previous body to combine the two prisms into one.</description>

Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single rectangular face (face\\_1). The face should have a loop (loop\\_1) that traces out the perimeter of the rectangle, formed by four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4). The lines should start and end at the following coordinates: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.3801, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.3801, 0.0], [0.3801, 0.1144] - line\\_3: [0.3801, 0.1144], [0.0, 0.1144] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.1144], [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3801. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch, creating a 3D model with dimensions 0.3801 x 0.75 x 0.3801. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism within a rectangular prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.3801, 0.1652, 0.0]. This will position and orient the coordinate system appropriately. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of two rectangular faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2). face\\_1 should have a loop (loop\\_1) that traces out the perimeter of the rectangle, formed by four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4). The lines should start and end at the following coordinates: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.0986, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.0986, 0.0], [0.0986, 0.1144] - line\\_3: [0.0986, 0.1144], [0.0, 0.1144] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.1144], [0.0, 0.0] face\\_2 should have a loop (loop\\_1) that traces out the perimeter of the rectangle, formed by four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4). The lines should start and end at the following coordinates: - line\\_1: [0.3216, 0.0], [0.4178, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.4178, 0.0], [0.4178, 0.1144] - line\\_3: [0.4178, 0.1144], [0.3216, 0.1144] - line\\_4: [0.3216, 0.1144], [0.3216, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.4178. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch, creating a 3D model with dimensions 0.1172 x 0.4178 x 0.4178. Use the “JoinFeatureOperation” operation to combine this 3D model with the previous one. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section.</description>
